name: AirScript: a DSL for writing AIR constraints
description:
Account abstraction has opened the door to gasless transactions, alternative authentication methods, social recovery, app accounts, and other innovations. However, it imposes in additional strain in the protocol, as validation is no longer a straightforward process. 

In this talk, we'll explore how working on a private-first network such as Aztec expands what's possible to do with account abstraction, as well as some new challenges that arise from it.

speakers.name: Bobbin Threadbare
speakers.bio: Bobbin Threadbare is a co-founder of Polygon and leads the Polygon Miden team. Prior to his time at Polygon, Bobbin worked as a research scientist at Meta, where he led the development of Winterfell, a highly performant general-purpose STARK prover. Bobbin has been active in Web3 since 2018. His focus and passion have always been building of open-source components fundamental to zero-knowledge tech to ensure a decentralized, private future of the web.
